thread.title: Ashley Roberts opens up about Scarlett Moffatt taking her job on Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway
thread.title_full: Ashley Roberts opens up about Scarlett Moffatt taking her job on Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway

author: Nicola Agius
title: Ashley Roberts opens up about Scarlett Moffatt taking her job on Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway
text:
Ashley Roberts opens up about Scarlett Moffatt taking her job on Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway The former Pussycat Doll was dropped by ITV in January after three years on the show Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Scarlett Moffatt goes from Jungle Queen to NTA winner Share this video Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Ashley Roberts has opened up about losing her job on Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway. 
Last month, ITV confirmed that after a successful three years of her presenting the hit show, producers had decided that they were dropping the former Pussycat Dolls star. 
Instead, they had given her role to Scarlett Moffatt following her I'm A Celebrity win. 
While Ashley is yet to reach out to the Gogglebox star about the news, the 35-year-old has insisted her is in full support of the move. Ashley Roberts has opened up about losing her job on Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway (Photo: WireImage) 
Speaking exclusively to BANG Showbiz about the 'I'm A Celebrity ... Get Me Out Of Here!' champion, she said: "I hope Scarlett has fun with them. There's nothing but well wishes, there really is. Read More Scarlett Moffatt signs 'absolute dream' deal to present Saturday Night Takeaway with Ant and Dec 
"I don't really know Scarlett. I didn't watch the Jungle, and I haven't really seen her so I don't really know her personally. But I'm sure the boys are going to have fun with her, and she'll have such a fun time." Last month, ITV confirmed that after a successful three years of her co-presenting the hit show, producers had decided that they were dropping the former Pussycat Dolls star (Photo: ITV) 
And the Allyn founder - who launched her footwear label, which was her first venture into the fashion industry, earlier this month - believes comedy duo Anthony McPartlin and Declan Donnelly will work well with Scarlett because they share the "same banter" as they are all from Newcastle. 
"I know they'll probably have a good time and have the same banter," she added. "I absolutely love and adore those boys and we've all talked. It's been a great run. I did four seasons with the boys and it's been awesome, I love them to pieces. I've known for a little while. Everybody reached out to me and we all had a nice discussion and it was handled well. Again, good wishes." Producers have given her role to Scarlett Moffatt following her I'm A Celebrity win (Photo: Getty Images Europe) 
Ashley plans to still tune into the show if she is "sitting alone" on a Saturday night. 
She said: "I'm sure, if I'm in London and sitting alone on a Saturday, I'll tune in for sure. They're really funny." 
However, the former Pussycat Dolls band member has teased she already has plans in place to join forces with Ant and Dec again. 
She added: "We all said we are going to work on something in the future." Like us on Facebook
